children.value: During today’s lesson it’s demonstrated how you to use the displacement method.
Given a structure as shown below:

For the displacement method, it’s needed to choose one or multiple degrees of freedom which describe the displacement of the full structure. Then, using equilibrium, this displacement can be solved for. In this case, that can be the horizontal and vertical displacement of

children.html: S\text{S}S

children.value: . A positive displacement is arbitrarily chosen for both of them:

children.alt: Displaced structure with assumed u_\text{B,h} and u_\text{b,v}

ub,vu_\text{b,v}ub,v​

children.value: Evaluating our previous expressions for the nodal forces gives:

children.html: NAS≈−8.57 kNN_{\text{AS}} \approx -8.57 \text{ kN}NAS​≈−8.57 kN
NSB≈21.4 kNN_{\text{SB}} \approx 21.4 \text{ kN}NSB​≈21.4 kN
NSC=−50 kNN_{\text{SC}} = -50 \text{ kN} NSC​=−50 kN

children.value:
import sympy as sym

EA = sym.nsimplify(5e3)

u_bh, u_bv = sym.symbols('u_bh u_bv')

deltaL_AS = + u_bh
deltaL_SB = - u_bh
deltaL_SC = - u_bv * 4 / 5 - u_bh / 5 * 3

N_AS = EA  * deltaL_AS / 5
N_SB = EA  * deltaL_SB / 2
N_SC = EA  * deltaL_SC / 5

display(N_AS, N_SB, N_SC)

eq1 = sym.Eq(-N_AS + N_SB + N_SC / 5 * 3 , 0)
eq2 = sym.Eq(40 + N_SC / 5 * 4, 0)

sol = sym.solve([eq1, eq2], (u_bh, u_bv))
display(sol)

for k, v in sol.items():
    display(k, v.evalf())   

display('N_AS =', N_AS.subs(sol).evalf())
display('N_SB =', N_SB.subs(sol).evalf())
display('N_SC =', N_SC.subs(sol).evalf())
Given a structure as shown below:
Again, it’s needed to choose one or multiple degrees of freedom which describe the displacement of the full structure. In this case, that can be the rotation of

children.html: D\text{D}D

children.value: . A positive displacement is arbitrarily chosen:

children.html: φD\varphi_\text{D}φD​

children.value: As the nodes will not displace, each element can be analysed using forget-me-nots. The directions of the bending moments are arbitrarily chosen:

children.html: AD\text{AD}AD

children.value: can be calculated using forget-me-nots as:

children.html: φD=5MDAD3EI+15⋅56EI\varphi_\text{D} = \cfrac{5M_\text{D}^\text{AD}}{3 EI} + \cfrac{ 15 \cdot 5}{6 EI}φD​=3EI5MDAD​​+6EI15⋅5​
MDAD=72000φD−7.5M_\text{D}^\text{AD} = 72000 \varphi_\text{D} - 7.5 MDAD​=72000φD​−7.5
DB\text{DB}DB
MDDB=180000φD−6M_\text{D}^\text{DB} = 180000 \varphi_\text{D} - 6 MDDB​=180000φD​−6
DC\text{DC}DC
MDDC=−72000φDM_\text{D}^\text{DC} = -72000 \varphi_\text{D}MDDC​=−72000φD​

φ=59EI=1216000=4.63⋅10−6 rad\varphi = \cfrac{5}{9EI} = \cfrac{1}{216000} = 4.63 \cdot 10^{-6} \text{ rad}φ=9EI5​=2160001​=4.63⋅10−6 rad

children.value:
phi = sym.nsimplify(5/9/120e3)
display('phi =', phi)
M_DB = - phi * 180000 - 6
display('M_DB =', M_DB)	
display('M_DB =', M_DB.evalf())
M_DC = -72000 * phi
display('M_DC =', M_DC)
display('M_DC =', M_DC.evalf())
M_AD = 72000 * phi - sym.nsimplify(15/2)
display('M_AD =', M_AD)
display('M_AD =', M_AD.evalf())
